poem:
The Sound of Stories  

In the stillness of young minds,  
a voice whispers gently,  
sheep-pigs and daemons dance,  
unfurling tales in shadows.  

Eyes closed, worlds unfold,  
like petals in morning light;  
children follow the audible threads,  
woven with care, unseen.  

Words, no longer anchored to paper,  
float free, stir the heart's pasture.
